description:
## Horizontal Computational Grid Registration

Register a horizontal computational grid definition.

A computational grid is composed of one or more horizontal subgrids on which different variables are calculated.

Grid IDs follow format: c[NNN] (e.g., c100, c101)

label: Grid ID
description: Unique identifier for this grid.\n\nFormat: c[NNN] where NNN is a number.

label: Description
description: Description to distinguish this grid from similar ones.\n\nInclude key characteristics like target use (atmosphere, ocean, etc.).
placeholder: e.g., Arakawa-C grid for atmospheric modelling with TL127 spectral transform

label: Arrangement
description:
Grid staggering arrangement.

Defines relative positions of mass-related and velocity-related variables.

- arakawa-a: Mass and velocity at same location
- arakawa-b: Velocity at corners of mass cells
- arakawa-c: Velocity at edge centers, perpendicular to edge
- arakawa-d: Velocity at edge centers, tangential to edge
- arakawa-e: Mass at velocity cell edge centers

label: Horizontal Subgrids
description: Semicolon-separated list of subgrid IDs that comprise this computational grid.\n\nSubgrids must be registered via the Horizontal Subgrid template.

label: Issue Kind
description: Select whether this is a new submission or modification of existing entry.
